thread.title: Afghan forces retake Kunduz city from Taliban - Ministry
thread.title_full: Afghan forces retake Kunduz city from Taliban - Ministry | MENAFN.COM

author: Kuwait News Agency (KUNA)
title: Afghan forces retake Kunduz city from Taliban - Ministry
text:
(MENAFN - Kuwait News Agency (KUNA)) Afghan security forces have recaptured Kunduz City, the capital of Afghanistan's northeastern Kunduz province, from Taliban rebels, the government announced on Thursday The Ministry of Defense in a statement said that the security forces took back Kunduz City despite strong resistance from the militants.
The ministry claimed that 150 insurgents had been killed and 90 others wounded in the offensive.
The Interior Ministry spokesman, Sediq Siddiqui also confirmed that security forces conducted an operation on Wednesday night to drive militants out of the city.
He said that the security forces were able to take control of the entire city during the operation that continued till early morning. NATO forces provided air support during the operation, Siddiqui added.
Early on Monday, hundreds of Taliban gunmen stormed Kunduz from various directions and captured it after a few hours of clashes with security forces. Afghan Ministry of Public Health on Tuesday confirmed that at least 16 people had been killed and more than 170 others injured during clashes.
